entries: A race of humanoids who dwell in the depths of the Frane mountain range, Eiclune are a secluded people. With thick white fur covering most of their body and large fangs growing from their mouths, Eiclune are naturally inclined to hunting prey within their snowy domain. Despite this, Eiclune tend to seek out communities outside of the mountains when they reach maturity due to the slow and lonely life that the mountains tend to bring. While the heat is often overwhelming for them, particularly in desert regions, Eiclune never cut their fur, believing it to be a mark of pride.

entries.name: Acclimated
entries: Your body is naturally adapted to the frigid mountains. When in hot climates such as desert or volcanic regions, you have {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on skill checks unless you are in shade or a sheltered area.

entries.name: Dense Fur
entries: While not wearing any armor, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: You have {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on all Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in cold and mountainous terrain.

entries.name: Primal Howl
entries: As a {@action bonus action}, you can unleash a roar from deep inside you, drawing the attention of nearby creatures. All creatures within 20 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw, or else they gain {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on attacks made against creatures other than you until the end of their next turn. The DC for this save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength score. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

Lizard-like people who dwell in the volcanic region of Deius, along the Burnt Ridge. Volcari have adapted to their climate in order to better survive the harsh temperatures. Volcari are a social culture, regularly celebrating individual and collective milestones and historical moments, including the Festival of Ash, Stonecoming, and the Torch Channel.

entries.name: Acclimated
entries: Your body is naturally adapted to the blistering heat of volcanic ranges. When in cold climates such as a tundra or mountain peaks, you have disadvantage on skill checks unless you are near a source of heat or a sheltered area.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to the time you spend in magma tunnels, your vision in dim conditions has improved. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Magmatic Scales
entries: You have resistance to fire damage. Additionally, you are not impeded by extreme heat.

entries.name: Membranous Grip
entries: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Natural Claws
entries: You have sharp claws that function as a natural weapon. This weapon has a range of 5 feet, uses your strength score and deals {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and {@damage 1d4} fire damage + your strength modifier on a hit.

Kythen dwell in the depths of Deius' oceans. Fish-like people with slitted eyes, webbed fingers and large membrane wings emerging from their back, they are hospitable to anyone who manages to find their homes. Kythen also live in lakes and rivers, although none stay far from a large source of water at any time.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe in both air and water. Additionally, you gain a swim speed of 30 ft.

entries.name: Aquatic Lineage
entries: You learn the cantrip {@spell Shape Water|XGE} and can cast the spell {@spell Create or Destroy Water|XPHB} once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. Additionally, when you reach 5th level, you can cast {@spell Wall of Water|XGE} once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. These spells use either your Charisma, Intelligence or Wisdom score, determined when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes are made to see in the depths of the ocean, improving your vision in darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Shimmering Wings
entries: When you move more than 15ft in a straight line while underwater in a turn, you can launch yourself 20ft into the air, provided you are near the surface. Additionally, you take half damage from falling, and only suffer a penalty from falling if you fall further than 20ft.

Rulers of the skies of Deius, Elesharn reside in the floating city of Man'shrae. Distrustful and unwelcoming to strangers, little is known about Elesharn culture to those who dwell on the land far below them. A race of people born in the clouds, Elesharn have soft features with lithe forms. Their skin is dappled with patches of translucent aqua which can be seen through, and their eyes are a cloudy white with no pupils.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Used to gazing up at the stars at night, your eyes have become able to see in dim light and darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Heightened Intellect
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence saving throws made against spells or other magical effects.

entries.name: Spiritual Mind
entries: You are proficient in {@skill Arcana} and one other skill of your choice from {@skill Religion} or {@skill History}.

entries.name: Weightless Form
entries: Instead of walking, standing or running, you can instead choose to hover up to 5 feet off the ground. While hovering, your base movement speed becomes 10 ft per round. While hovering this way, if you become knocked prone or more than 5 ft above the ground, the hovering ends and cannot be resumed until you are upright on solid ground. Additionally, you may cast the spell {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB} once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, targeting yourself only.

Gods rarely take lovers. And when they do, the odds of producing a child are next to none. But there are a few rare exceptions. These exceptions are called godlings. Born from beings who have defied fate, they have no fate of their own. Godlings are seen as incredibly powerful and desirable; thus young godlings must do their best to stay hidden or else risk kidnapping, ritual sacrifice, or worse.

entries.name: Blessed Parentage
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion} skill.

entries.name: Divine Sight
entries: You have 60ft of {@sense darkvision}. You have {@variantrule advantage} on all {@skill Perception} checks, and all {@skill Investigation} checks made to determine whether something is an illusion.

entries.name: Fateless
entries: Your starting {@variantrule Fate|Godhome} score is 0.

entries.name: Potent Blood
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

The denizens of the Archives and the great writers of fate, Luminar are responsible for the maintenance of the Great Tapestry. An alien looking race with pale, glowing skin, four arms and one large eye in the centre of their forehead, Luminar are truly separated from the continent of Deius. Hairless and with brittle bones, it is considered taboo for a Luminar to leave the Archives unless a creature whose fate they write has disrupted the Great Tapestry.

entries.name: Ascendant
entries: At the end of each long rest, select a language. You gain the ability to speak, read and write that language until your next {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

entries.name: Celestial Hue
entries: You emit an aura of 30ft of {@variantrule bright light|xphb} at all times.

entries.name: Heavenly Authority
entries: You have advantage on all Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks made to convince a creature to help you.

entries.name: Many Limbs
entries: You have two additional arms. Due to the brittleness of your bones, you are unable to hold anything that weighs more than one pound with these extra limbs. You do not gain any benefit to any attack actions you take, even if you are holding additional weapons.

entries.name: Writers of Fate
entries: When you fail an attack roll or saving throw, you may choose to add a bonus to that roll equal to your proficiency bonus, once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

When a person completes a tragic fate, they are sometimes offered reincarnation as an Angelkin before moving on to Rayse. The role of an Angelkin is to protect the Archive from threats and maintain the balance of the Great Tapestry. Angelkin are often sent between the different planes to complete these tasks. Angelkin take the form of who they were in their previous life, except with faintly glowing skin and large bird-like wings stretching from their back, as well as ritual markings along their body denoting their duty to the Archives.

entries.name: Sublime Essence
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Angelic Spirit
entries: Whenever you regain {@variantrule hit points|xphb}, you regain an additional number equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Winged
entries: You gain a flying speed of 30 ft.

entries.name: Hallowed Mind
entries: You don't need to sleep. You must spend at least 4 hours reflecting on the fate of the world in order to complete a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

Humanoids trapped in Oru often find their bodies shifting, infused with wild magic. Those who remain long enough for this process to be completed become Chaos-Spawn. No two Chaos-Spawn look the same, wildly varying in appearance and temperament.

entries.name: Altered Anatomy
entries: Your creature type is Elemental.

entries.name: Improved Movement
entries: When you take this race, you gain one of the following movement options:

items: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet.
You gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.
You gain a climbing speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Reactive Form
entries: You may cast the spell {@spell Absorb Elements|xge} once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb} without requiring a spell slot. If you have the spellcasting ability, you may cast this spell with any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Unstable
entries: At the end of a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, roll once on the Elemental Powers table. You gain the associated cantrip until your next long rest. Select Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma to be your spellcasting ability for these cantrips, chosen when you take this race.

Fluxborn are unstable beings created out of pure magic in the heart of Oru. There is no rhyme or reason for the creation of a Fluxborn, but they will not last long. Fluxborn have no reproductive organs and typically are drawn to a more hedonistic lifestyle, eager to experience all of what life has before they return to Oru. The death of a Fluxborn when their lifeforce runs out always results in a highly destructive burst of magic.

entries.name: Created Life
entries: You do not need to sleep, eat or breathe. You must have at least 4 hours of uninterrupted meditation to connect to the chaos of Oru to complete a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: The raw magic flowing through your blood enhances your senses and sight. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cant discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Made to End
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Magical Essence
entries: You have {@variantrule advantage} on saving throws against spells and magical effects. In addition, you have advantage on all saving throws against {@condition charmed||charm} effects and are immune to magical sleep.

Humanoids rarely enter the Astral Plane, but when they do, the mental energies and psychic storms begin to alter their forms and minds. Now more in touch with their mind and granted new psychic abilities, Vikasha feed upon the mental energy of others. Gaunt and with swirling, almost hypnotic eyes, they are indistinguishable from normal humanoids unless closely observed.

entries.name: Hidden Conscious
entries: As an action, while inside a dense crowd of people, you may turn {@condition invisible}. While invisible, humanoids within the crowd cannot sense your presence unless you intentionally touch them. This invisibility lasts for 1 minute, or until you make an attack, cast a spell or exit the crowd. You may do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

entries.name: Psyche Remade
entries: You have {@variantrule advantage} on death saving throws.

entries.name: Psychic Bite
entries: Transformed by the Astral Plane, you can lash out mentally as a creature. As a bonus action, you may force one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they take 3d6 psychic damage, and you gain a number of {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB} equal to half the damage dealt. The DC for this save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. You may use this ability once per long rest.

entries.name: Hypnotic Link
entries: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks against humanoids.

Creatures shaped by the ancient matter of life within the astral plane, Galdarians are tall and warped beings. Many of their features resemble that of the material plane’s sea creatures. Galdarians are typically slow and relaxed, rarely leaving the astral sea as there is little perceived need to do so. However, occasionally a Galdarian will fall through a portal leading to the Material Plane.

entries.name: Creature of the Depths
entries: You do not need to breathe, and you gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Primordial Legacy
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Shifting Form
entries: At the end of each long rest, choose one transformation to alter your body. This change lasts until your next long rest. You unlock more options for transformations at level 5.

items.name: Suction Cups
items.entry: You have climb speed equal to your walk speed.

items.name: Shifting Skin
items.entry: You can change the colour of your skin or make patterns appear on it. As an action, you can change your skin to match the colour and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks made to hide in those surroundings

items.name: Eyeless Sight
items.entry: You gain an additional 20 ft of {@sense Blindsight}.

items.name: Hydrostatic Skeleton
items.entry: You gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning damage. In addition, you can squeeze through gaps that are no smaller than 1 inch, provided you are not carrying any equipment on you.

items.name: Cecaelia Tentacles
items.entry: You grow 2d4 tentacles from your waist. These tentacles cannot carry anything heavier than 1 pound and have a reach of 5 ft. You may take the Interact with Object action as a bonus action.

variantrule.name: Fate
entries: Fate functions as a separate ability score that changes how the world around you reacts to you. Ability checks with Fate are generally used to determine luck in a situation. When determining your starting Fate, your score cannot be less than 1 or greater than 17 - You may either roll a d20 (rounding down as required) or choose a number with the DM that fits your Fatescore (If you are interested in starting with a Fate score of 0, please see the custom backgrounds. Below is a list of the general importance of each Fate score:

rows: Unimportant, commoners who live life day to day. Will likely never do anything remarkable in their lifetime.
A small town leader or low level adventurer, unlikely to enact any real change in the world.
A popular politician or mid level adventurer, with their own story. Their Fate is likely to impact themselves and the community around them.
Nobility or a strong adventurer who’s Fate may be so grand as to impact a large city or even a country.
A high level adventurer or a city leader who shapes the world around them, and will be remembered for many years.
An adventurer of legend, a favoured monarch, someone who will make history and will never fade from memory.
A force to rival the Gods, a hero who will save the worlds from calamity.
Unheard of. Destined for untold glory and greatness.

entries: Not only does your Fate score change how certain monsters and items interact with you, but it also empowers you. For each 4 points of Fate you have, you may increase any ability score by +1, for a maximum of 24 . However, a number of times equal to the bonuses granted by your Fate score per month, the DM may declare a new result for any dice roll you make. This result cannot be changed in any way.
Your Fate score can be changed by Gods, spells, magical items, the Archives, and by interacting with others with high Fate scores or grand destinies themselves.

spell.name: Magic Compass
entries: A glowing compass appears in front of you, pointing to a location of your choice within the spell's range. You must either know the general direction of the location or be familiar with the location. You may also specify a non-specific location such as a shop or inn, in which case the compass will point towards the nearest location that matches that description.
entriesHigherLevel: This spell's range increases to 1000 ft at 5th level, 2500 ft at 11th level and 1 mile at 17th level.

spell.name: Spiritual Discernment
entries: You touch one creature for a minute in order to sense its alignment. If that creature is unwilling or unaware of this spell being cast on it, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you do not learn of its alignment.

spell.name: Transmute Alcohol
entries: You transform 5 ounces of clean water into an alcoholic substance of your choice.

spell.name: Balance

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range would make an attack roll or saving throw

entries: You revert the natural order of the world for one creature. Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that would make an attack roll or a saving throw with either {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} or {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB}. You may instead choose to negate that advantage/disadvantage, forcing the creature to make a straight roll.

spell.name: Mayhem Twist
entries: You target a creature you can see within range, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw if unwilling. On a failure, that creature swaps places with you. When the spell ends, you swap places with that creature once again.

spell.name: Manipulate
entries: You pry open a creature's mental defenses. Select one creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, made at {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failure, that creature's mind becomes weakened against you, granting you {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made against it for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 2nd level or higher, you may choose an additional target for each spell slot above 1st.

spell.name: Return to Death
entries: You bring a creature closer to the plane of Rayse, realm of the dead. You may make a spell attack roll against one creature you can see within range. On a hit, that creature takes {@damage 3d6} force damage. If the creature is undead, this spell deals maximum damage instead.

spell.name: Spirit Ward
entries: You ward a creature against those with opposing intentions. Select an alignment from Good, Neutral or Evil. If a creature of the chosen alignment would attack the warded creature, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, or else take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and gain {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on the attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB} gained increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|3-9|1d8}

spell.name: Arcane Redirection

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you casts a single target spell

entries: Bending nearby magic, you twist the direction of a spell around you. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, you may select a new target for the spell. The new target may not be the caster of the spell, and you must choose a valid target for the spell.

spell.name: Chaos Surge
entries: Each creature within a 30 foot cube must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, roll an effect on the Chaotic Shift table for that creature, and it takes {@damage 2d8} force damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage.

entries.name: Chaotic Shift
rows: The creature subtracts a {@dice d6} from each ability check, attack roll and saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.
The creature becomes {@condition charmed|XPHB}, convinced that it is madly in love with you and will do anything to defend you until the end of its next turn.
The creature teleports 60ft in a random direction chosen by the GM and is {@condition stunned|XPHB} until the beginning of its next turn.
The creature gains {@variantrule vulnerability|XPHB} to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage until the beginning of its next turn

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|4-9|1d8} for each spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Veil of Protection

time.condition: which you may take whenever a creature you can see within 60 feet uses a physical area of effect spell or ability

entries: You conjure a mighty barrier around you to protect from an AOE ability such as a wizard's fireball or a dragon's breath weapon.

This barrier appears 5 ft above you and has a 10 ft radius, angled towards the source of your reaction. The barrier has 20 {@variantrule hit points|XPHB} and {@variantrule vulnerability|XPHB} to bludgeoning damage, and absorbs damage from the triggering source, protecting creatures under it. Once the barrier hits 0 hit points, it breaks, but reduces the damage taken by the amount the shield absorbed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th level or higher, the shield gains 10 {@variantrule hit points|XPHB} for each spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Alter Destiny

m.text: Weaver’s tools, a sapphire worth 500 gp which the spell consumes

entries: Tugging on threads of the Great Tapestry, you nudge a creature's fate in a certain direction. You can increase or decrease the {@variantrule Fate|Godhome} Score of a creature you touch for the spell's full casting time. The amount increased or decreased is equal to your spellcasting modifier. This spell cannot increase a creature's Fate Score to more than 17, or decrease it to less than 1. A creature can only benefit from this spell once per month.

spell.name: Reality Rip
entries: A 30ft sphere of darkness appears within range at a point of your choosing. All creatures within the space must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 12d12} necrotic damage, taking half damage on a success. If this damage reduces a creature to zero hit points, that creature is destroyed, any physical record of them including writing and drawings ceasing to exist, leaving the only trace of their existence as memories. A creature killed this way can only be revived by the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

spell.name: Invoke Legends

m.text: A depiction of a legend and a sapphire worth 10,000 gp which the spell consumes

entries: You focus your mind on an ancient legend long lost. The legend can be a place, object, or creature. The legend is summoned to your location within 30ft of you. If you focus on a place, up to 1 mile of the chosen place will appear around you. The chosen legend remains material for the duration of the spell and has all of the properties stated within the legend, however its total power cannot be stronger than any effect created by the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell. The legend's attitude towards you is not dictated by this spell.
